channel.title: Sinisterhood
channel.description: Dallas based comedians and friends, Christie Wallace and Heather McKinney, focus on a different true crime, cult, or creepy topic each week "and chat all things sinister in this funny and well-researched podcast." (Marie Claire, 2020)
channel.itunes:subtitle: Funny, creepy, smart ladies

item.title: Episode 211: The Curse of Captain Streeter
item.description:
Chicago is home to 200 vibrant neighborhoods each with its own personality and history. This chi-town legend created a one where there was only sand, water, and swamp. Where there’s lakefront property, there’s always greedy people eager to get their hands on it. But what they didn’t know was just who they were messing with.

item.title: Freaky Birthday
item.description: Happy Friday and Happy Birthday to Heather! We are taking this Friday off. If you still want to make your Friday a little freaky, head to moment.co/sinisterhood and watch our Dallas live show on-demand. We had a blast at the Texas Theatre talking the venue's connection to the JFK assassination and its supernatural occurrences. We also chat about the freakiest ghosts we've ever heard of, the Texas Crytpid Hall of Fame induction ceremony, a dose of true crime from our own backyard, and more! Watch the entire show on-demand for the next 10 days. This won't be released in our feed, so the only way to catch the fun is on Moment. Check it out before it's gone! Head to moment.co/sinisterhood for all the fun! Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Episode 210: Resurrection Mary
item.description:
A stretch of road on Chicago’s south side has been home to this eager passenger for a century. She accepted rides from strangers but wasn’t always the most gracious guest. Screaming, jumping in and out of the car, and in some cases, ghosting those who offered to take her home. Is this a case of mistaken identity and late night hallucinations? Or do drivers headed down archer simply need to prepare for an extra rider?

item.title: Episode 209: The Murder of Robert Poynter
item.description:
A decorated firefighter, a dedicated dad, and an optimistic husband. His family knew that they may lose him suddenly, but they never predicted the cause would be murder. Late one night in 2016, police responded to frantic 911 calls from a dirt road in Texas. When they arrived, the only witness began giving details that just didn’t add up.

item.title: Episode 208: The Baleroy Mansion - The Most Haunted Home in America
item.description:
Art, cars, crystals, and death chairs? This Philadelphia landmark was home to one of the city's greatest collectors - of antiques, priceless artifacts, and ghosts. When his family of Pennsylvania elites moved into the mansion on the hill, they had no way of knowing that some of the family members were moving in for eternity. Was this structure truly haunted or were spirits attached to the treasures within its walls?
Recorded live at Theatre for Living Arts in Philadelphia, PA

item.title: Best of Patreon: September 2022
item.description:
If you aren't subscribed to our Patreon, we wanted to give you a glimpse of what we've got going on. This mega-mix of clips brings you some of our favorite segments from the month of September. Subscribe today to get full segments plus hundreds of hours of past content.
Today you'll hear:
True Crime Headlines: Dallas doctor who killed two people with IV bags
Minisode: Loab, the AI Cryptid
Live Q&A: Episodes we'd save in a Y2K scenario + horror film reviews
Livestream: Rural Missed Connections poster is looking for Richard Football
Don't miss our October events:
Live Q&A is Wednesday, 10/19 at 8PM CT
Livestream is Thursday, 10/20 at 8PM CT
If you like what you hear and want full versions of all this and more, head to patreon.com/sinisterhood for full details on all the benefits and to subscribe today! Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Episode 207: The Unsolved Murders of the Jeff Davis 8 - Part 2.
item.description:
With 7 victims already found dead, the local police tried to appease families by creating a task force, but yet another body was found. Soon it would become apparent that the corruption plaguing the community for decades was powerful enough to infiltrate the task force, too. Years passed, suspects’ names were whispered by neighbors, but no arrests were made.

item.title: Episode 205: The Liberty Island Treasure
item.description:
The beautiful green goddess that guards the shores of the Big Apple has been a symbol of freedom and a beloved icon since her debut. But the island she stands on wasn’t always fit for a pedestal. Legend has it, she’s hiding a treasure worth millions beneath her foundation, leading pirates, soldiers, treasure hunters, and even ghosts to crowd her shores. Recorded live at City Winery in NYC

item.title: Episode 204: The Haunted History of Bunghole Liquors
item.description:
Once a coveted shipping port, this town has seen its share of tragedy. Centuries-old tales of torture, the wealthy elite sneaking around the law, and unsettled dead rising to make their presence known. But in this quaint seaside town lies a spooky place that has offered refuge for the living and the dead since Prohibition. When you stop in for a drink, will you end up seeing a specter among the six packs?
Recorded live at Laugh Boston in Boston, MA

item.title: Episode 202: The Murder of Sherri Rasmussen
item.description:
A leader in her field at such a young age, married to her dream man, she had no way of knowing her husband’s romantic past would destroy the future they were planning together. After she was brutally murdered at home, the delay of justice was lengthy, but her family never gave up hope. A tenacious criminalist. Two dedicated cold case detectives. One dangerous cop who ended up on the wrong side of the interrogation table.

item.title: Episode 201: Mayhayley Lancaster, The Oracle of the Ages
item.description:
Farmer, teacher, politician, lawyer, and clairvoyant? This legendary Georgian was the go-to source for finding lost items - and in some cases, lost bodies. Her roles as a champion for women and a source of knowledge and advice for her neighbors were outshone only by her incredible skills as a seer. Her remarkable life has been the subject of books and movies, and with all her powers, she’ll let people know if they’re doing her story justice.

item.title: Freaky Friday: Episode 25
item.description:

item.description:
Listener note: This episode contains discussions of alleged child sexual abuse and suicide. With her hypnotic voice and clever use of technology, Teal Swan amassed an online following that numbered in the millions. But the increased attention brought increased scrutiny - from regulators, cult experts, and victims’ families. Were the allegations that she was running baseless or were they rooted in her own documented behavior?

item.title: Episode 197: Teal Swan: Spiritual Influencer or Modern Day Cult Leader? - Part 1.
item.description:
Listener note: This episode contains discussions of alleged child sexual abuse and suicide.
A beautiful YouTuber gained millions of views, but the families of some of those swayed by her videos claim she took her influence too far. Soon accusations of practicing counseling without a license, leading a cult, and exerting mind control over her followers gained this content creator and spiritual leader quite a reputation. Is she a source of comfort for her followers? Or is she creating a community under her total control?

item.title: Episode 196: The Mysteries of the Mark Twain National Forest
item.description:
With its millions of acres of working forest, this nationally protected expanse attracts nearly a million visitors every year. In addition to birds, deer, and fish, those headed for the land may find themselves face to face with something not of this world. Whether you believe something sinister lingers in the forest, the pain of families who have lost loved ones among its trees is very real. How can we help reunite those missing with their loved ones?

item.title: Episode 195: The Ryman Auditorium and The Grand Ole Opry
item.description:
A beautiful structure looms over the bustling party scene of Broadway in the Music City. A venue like no other, this building's religious beginnings give it a stately elegance. The music that echoed through its halls has made careers and, according to some, started curses. Some restless souls never left the hallowed halls of the Mother Church of Country Music.
Recorded live at Zanies in Nashville, TN

item.title: Episode 194: The Nain Rouge
item.description:
It takes boldness to build a city, but for Motown’s founder, being self-assured meant his downfall. The hubris of man is a dangerous thing, but not as dangerous as a demonic force that must be appeased to keep it from wreaking havoc on those it encounters. Detroiters know to beware of this devilish creature, if not, the consequences can be severe.
Recorded live at the Majestic Theatre in Detroit, MI

item.title: Introducing: Let's Change Beauty with Jess Weiner
item.description:
We would love to introduce you to "Let's Change Beauty" - a podcast powered by the Dove Self-Esteem Project. Let’s Change Beauty features intimate conversations with esteemed experts and celebrated guests from the worlds of beauty, gaming, sports, technology and entertainment. What if we could work together to create a world where we define beauty on our own terms? This is the world that cultural expert and host of Let's Change Beauty, Jess Weiner, invites you to help make a reality. We hope you listen and subscribe!

You'll hear:
Confessions from Reddit's OffMyChest about tripping a stranger

item.title: Episode 193: The Gibraltar Point Lighthouse
item.description:
A beautiful structure meant to guide sailors home safely. A benevolent keeper who gladly hosted soldiers for a drink. But that kindness may have gotten him killed, and left him forever tending the island’s light. Is this just a spooky old building or the eternal home to a restless soul? Tonight’s episode is The Gibraltar Point Lighthouse.
Recorded live at the Royal Theatre in Toronto, CA

item.title: Episode 192: The Fresno Nightcrawler
item.description:
A resident of this central California town captured footage of an unidentifiable creature scurrying across his lawn. He offered the tape to experts and the media who couldn’t determine what this strange monster was. Soon, more sightings were reported across California and beyond. The odd-shaped scampering being didn’t do any harm and was soon embraced as an online phenomenon. Click here for information on our tour and to purchase tickets!

What started as a revolutionary state organization crumbled into decay before being saved by passionate citizens. But just as passionate are the former inmates who refuse to leave.

item.title: Episode 189: The Murder of Betty Gore - Part 2
item.description:
With an extra-marital affair behind them, Allan and Betty Gore seemed to be back on track in their marriage. Betty was leading a Marriage Encounter group, and Allan was trying to reduce the number of work trips that took him away from his wife and their five-year-old and eleven-month-old daughters. When he left on a work trip Friday, June 13, 1980, Allan never knew that would be the last time he would see his wife alive. Their small community would be rocked by a brutal murder committed in broad daylight by someone so close to them.

Betty was leading a Marriage Encounter group, and Allan was trying to reduce the number of work trips that took him away from his wife and their five-year-old and eleven-month-old daughters. When he left on a work trip Friday, June 13, 1980, Allan never knew that would be the last time he would see his wife alive. Their small community would be rocked by a brutal murder committed in broad daylight by someone so close to them.

item.title: Episode 188: The Murder of Betty Gore - Part 1
item.description:
It seemed like the perfect small town. A quaint place outside the bustling technology corridor developing in Dallas in the late 1970s. Men went to work. Women volunteered at church. But bubbling underneath the surface was a web of deceit that would eventually turn deadly.

item.title: Episode 187: The Gates of Hell
item.description:
The discovery city, the capital of Ohio. C-bus is the gateway to many things - Industry, museums, and a world-class education at The Ohio State University. But lurking just moments away from the home of the Buckeyes is a doorway to something more sinister. Is this location just a hangout for skaters and teens or is it a portal to the underworld?
Recorded live at Funny Bone in Columbus, Ohio

item.title: Episode 186: The Disappearance of Daniel Robinson
item.description:
He was a young geologist in Arizona pursuing his passion. Then one day, everything changed. He vanished without a trace sending his family into a frantic search to find where he had gone. They faced roadblocks with rough terrain, lack of resources, and harsh desert conditions. But his passionate father refuses to give up the fight and is asking for help.

item.title: Lorena Bobbit: Part 2 (Re-Release)
item.description:
CW: This episode contains discussions of domestic violence and sexual assault
In case you missed it, a new special titled Lorena: Escaping Bobbitt premiered this past week. The new special shows Lorena offering details about the abuse she suffered during her marriage as well as the ongoing harassment she faces from John to this day. In our episodes, we dive into her history, tell the story of that fateful night, and provide legal analysis of the trials.
After the media got ahold of the initial details of the case, the circus began. But the truth would come out via the testimony of dozens of witnesses at trial. One woman was both a defendant and a victim, and the trial focused on the reign of terror she had endured. But the verdict wasn't the end of her story.
Click here for information on our tour and to purchase tickets!
Please consider supporting the companies that support us! -Go to JustThriveHealth.com and use code CREEPY at checkout for 15% off your order - Ready to awaken your inner detective? Download June’s Journey free today on the Apple App Store or Google Play -Click here to join our NAMIWalks Your Way 2022 team to help make our dream of Mental Health For All a reality Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Lorena Bobbit: Part 1 (Re-Release)
item.description:
CW: This episode contains discussions of domestic violence and sexual assault
In case you missed it, a new special titled Lorena: Escaping Bobbitt premiered this past week. The new special shows Lorena offering details about the abuse she suffered during her marriage as well as the ongoing harassment she faces from John to this day. In our episodes, we dive into her history, tell the story of that fateful night, and provide legal analysis of the trials.
What began as a young woman’s dream come true ended in a nightmare that would become internationally known in headlines, on the covers of tabloids, and broadcast on news shows. But the true story behind the punchline was even more horrifying than the media ever explained.

CW: This episode contains discussions of domestic violence and sexual assault


In case you missed it, a new special titled Lorena: Escaping Bobbitt premiered this past week. The new special shows Lorena offering details about the abuse she suffered during her marriage as well as the ongoing harassment she faces from John to this day. In our episodes, we dive into her history, tell the story of that fateful night, and provide legal analysis of the trials.


What began as a young woman’s dream come true ended in a nightmare that would become internationally known in headlines, on the covers of tabloids, and broadcast on news shows. But the true story behind the punchline was even more horrifying than the media ever explained.

item.title: Episode 185: The Hat Man
item.description:
Deep in the night, out of the shadows, a figure emerges. Tall and thin, it glides toward you, but all you see is its flowing cloak and signature hat. When you ask others about what you’ve seen - you find out you’re not the only one to experience this worldwide phenomenon. Is he real? Is he a figment of your imagination? Or is he something not of this realm?

A ghost that feels the need to set the house alarm...but is it to keep someone in, or something out? A stabbing that wasn't meant to be seen. A familiar face, or so you think. item.title: The Disappearance of Kristin Smart: Part 3 (Re-Release)
item.description:
Since we covered Kristin's case, a month and a half-long preliminary hearing was held to determine whether the case against Paul and Ruben could proceed. The court heard testimony from more than two dozen witnesses, including law enforcement officials, former friends and acquaintances of both Paul and Kristin, cadaver dog handlers, and soil experts. In September 2021, the judge in the case ruled that there is sufficient evidence to move the case forward to trial. Currently, the trial is set to occur on April 25, 2022.
Years passed and the Smart family was no closer to finding answers to what happened to their daughter on May 25, 1996. Once civilians and private detectives stepped in, the family saw some progress. It wasn't until a new sheriff was elected that moves were made. What eventually brought the case close to an end was a breakout podcast that shed new light on the details and unearthed new clues, finally leading to some arrests in the case. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: The Disappearance of Kristin Smart: Part 2 (Re-Release)
item.description:
Since we covered Kristin's case, a month and a half-long preliminary hearing was held to determine whether the case against Paul and Ruben could proceed. The court heard testimony from more than two dozen witnesses, including law enforcement officials, former friends and acquaintances of both Paul and Kristin, cadaver dog handlers, and soil experts. In September 2021, the judge in the case ruled that there is sufficient evidence to move the case forward to trial. Currently, the trial is set to occur on April 25, 2022.
With their daughter missing, her devastated parents relied on law enforcement to conduct a thorough investigation. To their dismay, the case was passed between departments and delayed long enough for key evidence to be lost. Despite sufficient evidence for officers to identify a suspect, they needed his cooperation to close the case. All the suspect was willing to do was plead the fifth. Decades would pass before they got any real answers. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: The Disappearance of Kristin Smart: Part 1 (Re-Release)
item.description:
Since we covered Kristin's case, a month and a half-long preliminary hearing was held to determine whether the case against Paul and Ruben could proceed. The court heard testimony from more than two dozen witnesses, including law enforcement officials, former friends and acquaintances of both Paul and Kristin, cadaver dog handlers, and soil experts. In September 2021, the judge in the case ruled that there is sufficient evidence to move the case forward to trial. Currently, the trial is set to occur on April 25, 2022.
Four students leaving a party. A dark street. A short walk back to campus. But for one college freshman, the person trusted to walk her home seems to be the reason she was never seen again. For decades, the case lingered, the investigation changed hands, and it wasn’t until a renewed media scrutiny that arrests were made. Did authorities have their suspect from day 1?

item.title: Episode 179: The Tinder Swindler
item.description:
He matched with women online, flaunting his high-roller lifestyle, telling tales of family riches, and sharing fears about dangerous enemies. Soon, the enemies would supposedly come calling, and this prince charming would ask women to cover his exorbitant bills. Estimates are that he took his victims for over $10 million, yet today he walks as a free man in Gucci shoes. What happened and why has he, so far, evaded major consequences?

item.title: The Murder of Ellen Greenberg (Re-Release)
item.description:
Ellen's family got some bad news at the end of February when the Pennsylvania attorney general's office reviewed the case again and still supports suicide as her cause of death despite all the evidence. Her parents told CBS News they were disgusted and disappointed by the finding. The Greenbergs are still in the process of suing Philadelphia, trying to change Ellen’s manner of death from suicide to homicide or undetermined. We've included a link to her family's petition at the top of our show notes. The petition also includes ways to get in touch with Attorney General Josh Shapiro and demand that his office re-open her case.

item.title: Episode 176: Dragons
item.description:
Ancient civilizations around the world have included imagery of this mythic beast in pieces that have lasted centuries. In each culture, it represents something different - strength, nobility, an enemy to be defeated. But how did such a myth evolve in far-flung regions around the world with no connection to one another? Could these ancient monsters be even more ancient than we imagined? And are they hiding out waiting to be discovered to this very day?

item.title: Episode 175: The Wrongful Conviction of Ryan Ferguson - Part 2
item.description:
Arrested for something someone saw in their dreams, Ryan Ferguson hoped justice would prevail in court. He wasn’t prepared to face a corrupt system, fabricated evidence, and a prosecutor who seemed willing to do anything to win. It would take an army to right some of the wrongs, but an innocent man remains in jail and a killer is still on the loose.

item.title: Episode 174: The Wrongful Conviction of Ryan Ferguson - Part 1
item.description:
A college town is shocked by the heinous and violent murder of one of the city’s most beloved journalists. For two years, the case was cold until an unlikely pair of suspects emerged. The only problem? There was no evidence linking either of them to the crime. Still, one of them confessed leading to a years-long battle for justice.

item.title: Episode 173: The Flannan Isle Mystery
item.description:
Three hearty lighthouse keepers. One jagged island with a tough reputation. They were prepared for harsh weather and isolated conditions, but suddenly they vanished. Did they simply succumb to harsh weather? Or was something more sinister to blame?

item.title: Best of Patreon: January 2022
item.description:
If you aren't subscribed to our Patreon, we wanted to give you a glimpse of what we've got going on. This mega-mix of clips brings you some of our favorite segments from the month of January.
You'll hear clips about: - Mysterious street art in Dallas that accuses the city's founders of being more than human; - One couple's heinously exclusionary guest list for their wedding; - What cryptid we'd make a documentary about; and - A Bridezilla's 17-point list of demands for guests of her wedding.

item.title: Episode 172: The North Pond Hermit - Christopher Thomas Knight
item.description:
The past two years have made us all feel a little isolated. But this man took the concept of solitude to another level. 27 years in the woods alone, and he never once sought out human contact. He sought out other things, though, - books, food, clothes, tools, and anything else he could get his hands on. Was he an unrepentant criminal or just a guy trying to make it on his own?

item.description:
A legendary brand. A family legacy. A tumultuous love affair that cost a man his life. Hollywood has put its own spin on this story, but the movie’s subjects have made their anger with their portrayal well known. Is there more to this story than the film would have you believe?

item.title: A Conversation With Tybee Diskin from Chasing Immortality
item.description:
We were so fortunate to sit down with Tybee Diskin from the excellent podcast Chasing Immortality! After we covered the wild world of Transhumanism, we wanted to get Tybee’s insights as she covered FM-2030 on her past season. We also talk about the ethics of transhumanism, how we’re closer to the singularity than we even realize, and Tybee’s hilarious run-in with Google voice assistant. Next season, Chasing Immortality will cover Ray Kurzweil, and we can’t wait to chat with Tybee again once that episode is released. Until then, check out Chasing Immortality wherever you get your podcasts, and be sure to check out her in-depth episode on FM-2030, available now.
Thanks again to Tybee for joining us, and we hope you all enjoy our conversation! Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Episode 170: The Transhumanism Movement
item.description:
Benjamin Franklin once said, “In this world, nothing can be said to be certain, except death and taxes.” While this group of genius thinkers may not be able to stop the inevitability of taxes, they’re working together to eliminate that relentless foe who comes for us all - death. Will technology enable us to outrun our impending demise? And will it happen sooner rather than later?

item.title: Introducing: Murderish
item.description:
We would like to introduce you to Jami Rice's podcast, MURDERISH - a true crime podcast that delves into true stories of murder, disappearances and other creepy events. Also featured are in-depth interviews with high-profile people in the true crime community. This podcast will take you on a deep-dive journey through interesting cases, beginning the date of the crime and ending with the courtroom verdict. If you are fascinated by true crime, and all that embodies the genre, this podcast will appeal to you. Listening to this podcast doesn’t make you a murderer, it just means you’re murder-ish.
https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/murderish/id1317929691 Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Episode 168: Kallikantzaroi - The Christmas Goblins
item.description:
Thank you to our Patrons in the Getting Into It tier for selecting this topic!
One of the things that make the holiday season so magical is the variety of traditions and legends from around the world. From Santa to Krampus, to Ol’ Saint Nick, each year mythical creatures slink into our homes with a variety of purposes. But these feisty holiday sprites have only one gift to give you this holiday season: Chaos. Hang on to your sausages and ready your witty replies, the Kallikantzaroi are coming to town!

item.title: Episode 167: The Unsolved Murder of Patsy Wright
item.description: A beloved mom, sister, boss, and businesswoman carrying on her family’s legacy, co-running the company her father started. When she was found poisoned - her family all had one question: Who could have committed such a heinous act? The list of suspects from her professional and personal lives stacked up, but police never made an arrest. Will there ever be an answer for her family in this decades-old cold case? Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: The Santa Claus Bank Robbery (Re-Release)
item.description:
You better watch out, you better not cry, you better hold your hands up high because Santa has a gun and is robbing the place. In 1927, a Texas town was shaken up at Christmas when St. Nick pulled a heist on the local bank. A manhunt ensued, and in true Texas fashion, the citizens ensured some form of justice was finally served, no matter the cost.

item.title: Episode 166: Horror Movie Curses
item.description:
When you turn on a scary movie, you expect to be frightened by what you see on screen. But for these movies, what happened behind the scenes was also the stuff of nightmares. Is this the case of simple coincidence, with large casts and crews falling victim to unfortunate but common tragedies? Or, were these films cursed by their supernatural subject matter?

item.title: Episode 165: The Trial of Julius Jones
item.description:
In July 1999, Paul Howell was murdered in front of his sister and two young daughters during a carjacking. When police tracked the vehicle, it led them to a gang affiliate who pointed a finger at the shooter. After a trial tainted with racial bias, under-resourced defense attorneys, and a prosecutor hell-bent on securing an execution, the defendant was sentenced to death. But for decades he proclaimed his innocence and begged for his life. Did the jury convict the right man?

item.title: Episode 164: Meltdown at the Wax Museum
item.description:
Thousands of square feet filled wall to wall with your favorite celebrities. While this may sound like a dream come true for some, when you notice none of them are moving - or even alive - it quickly turns into a nightmare. This palace on the highway is a fun destination for school kids and tourists, but don’t find yourself locked inside after hours. You may encounter something spooky or worse…

item.title: Episode 163: The Houston Batman
item.description:
You hear the sounds of wings flapping against a clear night sky. In the trees, you spot something. Unlike any bird or creature you've ever seen before, the beast makes eye contact with you then jets off into the night. It's not a bird. It's not a plane. It's the Houston Batman.

item.title: Episode 161: The Devil's Bridge
item.description:
Engineers study for years to gain the skills necessary to build impressive roadways. But what if, instead of school, they called on help from a much darker place? Was this architectural feat created by the hands of mere mortals? Or did Lucifer himself help craft an expanse that leads straight to hell?

item.title: The Best of Patreon: October 2021
item.description:
If you aren't subscribed to our Patreon, we wanted to give you a glimpse of what we've got going on. This mega-mix of clips brings you some of our favorite segments from the month of October.
In this peek, you'll hear a clip from our listener-submitted Am I The Asshole segment where we advise someone on her secret-spilling mom. Then you'll hear us tackle a Reddit Am I the Asshole where a father-to-be prioritizes beats over his new baby. Next, you'll hear us in the Q&A answer a spooky would-you-rather question. Then you'll hear us give Relationship Advice on what to do when your house guests start moving in on your man.
To hear full episodes and see all the videos, head over to patreon.com/sinisterhood for full episodes, details on all the benefits, and to subscribe today!
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Episode 160: Skinwalker Ranch
item.description:
For centuries, this region was home to bright lights in the sky and treacherous monsters on the land and water. Soon, it became clear - nearly all of the out-of-this-world events centered around one family’s homestead. Once word spread, journalists, scientists, researchers, and billionaires descended on the place, hoping to capture hard evidence. Is what they found proof of visitors from another world or just the basis for a great story?

item.title: Introducing: Black Girl Gone
item.description: Hello everyone! We would like to introduce you to Black Girl Gone a true-crime podcast that tells the stories of missing and murdered Black women and women of color in America. Host Amara tells the stories of missing women and solved and unsolved murders weekly. Some of these cases you may have heard before but many of them you have not. Amara tells these stories with a focus on who these women were before they became victims while exploring the crimes and circumstances that took their lives. Black Girl Gone is helping to bring light to stories that often get left in the dark. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Episode 159: The Stanley Hotel
item.description:
One man set out for Colorado, looking for the healing power of the mountains where built himself a grand empire. A half a century later, with the enormous structure crumbling, an author on a mission happened upon the place and introduced it to his readers as one of the most haunted hotels in the country. Were the ghosts always there, waiting to show themselves to a willing visitor, or is this another one of the legendary writer’s creative tales? This week's episode is The Stanley Hotel.

item.title: A Conversation With Ben and Ronnie from Watch What Crappens
item.description: We were so fortunate to sit down with Ben and Ronnie from the Bravo-tastic podcast Watch What Crappens! After we covered the crimes of Jen Shah, we wanted to get the insights of some Real Housewives experts - and nobody knows Bravo better than Ben & Ronnie. We also talk about who our favorite housewives are, updates on the Housewife and the Hustler Erika Jayne and Tom Girardi, and all our hot takes on Jen Shah's alleged crimes. You can also check us out on their feed in a bonus episode where we discuss Teddi Mellencamp's MLM scheme and the various lawsuits of PK and Dorit on the Real Housewives of Beverley Hills. Be sure to check out their show - Watch What Crappens - wherever you get your podcasts. Thanks again to Ben and Ronnie for joining us, and we hope you all enjoy our conversation. We were so fortunate to sit down with Ben and Ronnie from the Bravo-tastic podcast Watch What Crappens!

After we covered the crimes of Jen Shah, we wanted to get the insights of some Real Housewives experts - and nobody knows Bravo better than Ben & Ronnie.

We also talk about who our favorite housewives are, updates on the Housewife and the Hustler Erika Jayne and Tom Girardi, and all our hot takes on Jen Shah's alleged crimes.

You can also check us out on their feed in a bonus episode where we discuss Teddi Mellencamp's MLM scheme and the various lawsuits of PK and Dorit on the Real Housewives of Beverley Hills. Be sure to check out their show - Watch What Crappens - wherever you get your podcasts. Thanks again to Ben and Ronnie for joining us, and we hope you all enjoy our conversation.

item.title: Episode 158: The Crimes of Jen Shah
item.description:
In Season 1, she introduced herself to us as being queen bee and MVP, but by Season 2 of Real Housewives of Salt Lake City, the MVP was staring down a possible 30 years in the federal penitentiary. Though the only guilt she admits to is being "Shah-Mazing" the jury may hand down a much harsher conviction.

item.title: The Best of Patreon: September 2021
item.description:
If you aren't subscribed to our Patreon, we wanted to give you a glimpse of what we've got going on. This mega-mix of clips brings you some of our favorite segments from the month of August.
First, You'll hear a clip from our r/JustNoMIL segment about a wedding nightmare where a pushy mother-in-law spoiled the couple's wedding photos. Next, you'll hear a clip from our latest Minisode that covers playing cards used to solve cold cases. Then, we have a clip from our September Q&A. Patreon subscribers get to watch a livestream video version of this and participate with us via the chat. This clip includes an existential question that made us laugh and think. Finally, you'll hear a clip from our livestream performance of Reddits' Am I The Asshole, where we cover a workplace incident involving a boss's out-of-control mom.
If you like what you hear and want full versions of all this and more, head to patreon.com/sinisterhood for full details on all the benefits to subscribe today! Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: A Legal Explanation and Discussion on SB8
item.description:
This is a special bonus episode we're releasing at the request of our Patreon subscribers. We normally do "true crime headlines" as part of our weekly bonus content, but when we covered the new Texas abortion ban SB8, our Patreons asked if we could make it public so they could share. Seeing as we live in Texas, we have received a lot of questions lately about SB8. In this segment, we discuss the legal and constitutional questions and violations pertaining to the ban. Of course, our own opinions are thrown in as well. If you're interested, please listen. If this isn't for you, that's ok, too. We hope this provides a quick overview for you on what the law means, its constitutionality, and where the law is headed going forward as it impacts all people seeking access to reproductive care. We recorded this a few weeks ago when the law first went into effect. Since then, there have been some news updates, movement in litigation challenging SB8, and clarifications in the analysis of the law including who it does and does not apply to. So as we say in the segment, be sure to keep up with the updates on this law as it impacts you and those you love. You can also visit the episode link for updates that have happened since we recorded.
All our love, from TX Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

This is a special bonus episode we're releasing at the request of our Patreon subscribers. We normally do "true crime headlines" as part of our weekly bonus content, but when we covered the new Texas abortion ban SB8, our Patreons asked if we could make it public so they could share.

Seeing as we live in Texas, we have received a lot of questions lately about SB8. In this segment, we discuss the legal and constitutional questions and violations pertaining to the ban. Of course, our own opinions are thrown in as well. If you're interested, please listen. If this isn't for you, that's ok, too. 

We hope this provides a quick overview for you on what the law means, its constitutionality, and where the law is headed going forward as it impacts all people seeking access to reproductive care. We recorded this a few weeks ago when the law first went into effect. Since then, there have been some news updates, movement in litigation challenging SB8, and clarifications in the analysis of the law including who it does and does not apply to. So as we say in the segment, be sure to keep up with the updates on this law as it impacts you and those you love. All our love, from TX

item.title: Episode 156: Polybius
item.description:
At the height of the video game craze in the early 80s, this arcade machine was said to take from its players a lot more than quarters. Kids who spent time in front of its screen allegedly suffered headaches, nightmares, amnesia, or worse. Soon men in black suits whisked the cabinets away, leaving behind nothing but a legend. Was this a case of the government using mass media to control the minds of the youth, or can this story be rated M for myth?

item.title: The Best of Patreon: August 2021
item.description: Hey, y'all! If you aren't subscribed to our Patreon, we wanted to give you a glimpse of what we've got going on! This mega-mix of clips brings you some of our favorite segments from the month of August. You'll hear a ruling from Judge Christie on a physical altercation at the happiest place on Earth, our advice to a listener on wedding planning for an absentee-future-sister-in-law, our guesses on what's in a mystery box that a worried wife found in her fridge, our reaction to unspeakable photos a woman found on her husband's phone, and a clip from our most recent minisode: the second part of our update on Britney Spears and her conservatorship battle. item.title: Episode 153: The Murdaugh Family Murders - Part 3
item.description:
After the prosecutor recused himself citing conflicts of interest, the state of the Murdaugh murder investigation seemed to stall. Then, breaking news reports on the shooting of yet another member of the family who happened to be the only named person of interest in the June slayings. Who could have attacked the once prominent trial lawyer? And what led to his sudden resignation from the firm his family started?

item.title: Episode 152: The Murdaugh Family Murders - Part 2
item.description:
With a string of deadly incidents in their wake, members of a powerful Lowcountry family suddenly found themselves searching for justice. Two brutal slayings, a rain-soaked crime scene, and several possible motives. Authorities are only releasing new information in tiny increments causing speculation to run rampant. With the solicitor in charge finally recusing himself due to conflicts, does that point to a possible development?

item.title: Episode 151: The Murdaugh Family Murders - Part 1
item.description:
For generations, a single family wielded control over the justice system of South Carolina’s Lowcountry. Over the past six years, five people with ties to the legendary family have been killed. Is this just a coincidence in a tight-knit community, or is there a more sinister explanation?

item.title: Episode 150: Havana Syndrome
item.description:
We're going on tour! We'll be heading to seven cities throughout September and October. Tickets go on sale to the public on Thursday, August 19, but Patreon Subscribers can get tickets now. Head to sinisterhood.com/liveshows to check out where we're headed, dates, times, and COVID protocols for each venue. And head to Patreon.com/Sinisterhood to get your early access to tickets and your exclusive presale code. See you on the road!
The United States finally rekindled its long-lost relationship with its Caribbean neighbor. But not long after being sent to their reopened embassy, American diplomats and CIA officers began complaining of strange symptoms. Then the symptoms spread to their Canadian colleagues. Later, diplomats worldwide would be afflicted by this series of incidents. Was it a concentrated attack from an unknown foe? Or was it all in their heads?

item.title: Episode 149: The Wrongful Conviction of Clemente Aguirre-Jarquin
item.description:
A young man with his whole life ahead of him set his sights on sunny Florida in order to escape life-threatening gang violence in his hometown. But when he arrived, he found himself in the wrong place at the wrong time. After a hasty trial, he was convicted of double murder and faced a death sentence. Would DNA and multiple confessions from another suspect be enough to set him free?
If you would like to support Clemente, you can donate at https://www.mightycause.com/story/Clementeaguirree2019

You'll hear clips about a man's possibly illegal yogurt collection, our advice to a listener about overcoming past trauma, a ruling from Judge Christie on a man's loss of his ridiculously huge adult video collection, our breakdown on the court opinion that let Bill Cosby out of jail, and our minisode updating you on Britney Spears and her conservatorship battle.

If you like what you hear and want full versions of all this and more, head to patreon.com/sinisterhood for full details on all the benefits and to subscribe today! 

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Robert The Doll (Re-release)
item.description:
Hey everyone, we’re taking the week off. We’ll be back next week with a brand new episode. This week, we're re-releasing our episode on the mischievous haunted doll, Robert, and all his antics. In the meantime, you can head over to our Patreon for some bonus content like our minisodes, including a recent update on the #FreeBritney movement and a Reddit relationship_advice segment that had both of our jaws on the floor. We also added an all-new segment, Dear Sinister, where we take personal questions from listeners and provide them with our best advice. Thanks so much and keep it creepy!
A harmless gift, a simple doll in a boy’s sailor suit. But for one man, this doll was more than a plaything, it was a companion, a lifelong friend, and a force in his life. Is this creation, made of fabric and wool, nothing more than a misunderstood toy? Or has he earned his reputation through decades of chaos and destruction?

item.title: Introducing: Murder With My Husband
item.description: It's our pleasure to introduce you to ​Murder With My Husband -​​ ​a t​rue crime podcast that offers an unique perspective on true crime podcasting as a husband and wife duo because she loves it and he hates it!​ ​Listen each week as Payton Moreland, true crime lover, researches the darkest true crime stories and recounts every detail to her husband Garrett Moreland to get his raw reaction as a true crime hater.​ ​Each episode is a new true crime case that Garrett is hearing for the first time. Together, they discuss how they each see the morbid details differently from opposite sides of the spectrum. Two points of view, one true crime podcast. So w​h​ether you’re a lover or a hater, there’s a place for you on ​this podcast​. New episodes drop each Sunday night. Murder With My Husband — she loves it and he hates it! https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/murder-with-my-husband/id1508098400 Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Episode 148: Gwen Shamblin Lara and the Weigh Down Diet - Part 2
item.description:
CW: This episode contains discussions of weight loss methods and diet culture as well as brief mentions of child abuse. Listener discretion is advised. It’s one thing to start your own church, but this fervent leader created an intense group that slowly took over its members’ lives - allegedly controlling who they married, how much they weighed, and even what psychiatric medication they were allowed to take. It looked like an empire that would continue to grow and last forever. Then a sudden tragedy changed it all. What’s next for this controversial group?

item.title: Episode 147: Gwen Shamblin Lara and the Weigh Down Diet - Part 1
item.description:
CW: This episode contains discussions of weight loss methods and diet culture as well as brief mentions of child abuse. Listener discretion is advised. A self-described dumb blonde with a genuine heart for God, this registered dietician combined her love of the Lord with her professional training to craft her lightning rod hit weight loss program. But what started as a health venture morphed into a strict religious sect that concerned religious scholars and controlled its members’ everyday behaviors - sometimes with deadly consequences.

item.title: Episode 146: El Chupacabra
item.description:
Under the cover of darkness, an unknown monster stalked its prey in Puerto Rico and throughout south Texas, leaving farm animals and house pets completely drained of their blood via two vampire-like puncture wounds in their necks. Witnesses reported sightings of a grotesque creature, sparking rumors that the true culprit was something much more sinister than any predator they had ever seen before.

item.title: Episode 145: Tom and Erika Girardi, The Hustler and the Housewife - Part 2
item.description: She's an enigma wrapped in a riddle and cash - that has been allegedly taken from the pockets of the victims of tragedy. With her husband and his firm under investigation, and his so-called house of cards collapsing, the realest of housewives dropped an election day bombshell - she was filing for divorce. But was it due to years of mistreatment as she said? Or, was it really a sham meant to keep her hands on that precious cash to fund her lavish lifestyle? Learn more about your ad choices. item.description: Hey, y'all! If you aren't subscribed to our Patreon, we wanted to give you a glimpse of what we've got going on. This mega-mix of clips brings you some of our favorite moments in recent weeks. You'll hear clips from our minisode on the unbelievable McDonald's Strip Search Scam, our advice to a listener whose boyfriend led a double life in our "Dear Sinister" segment, the chilling details of a cluster of suicides at a college in Missouri in our "True Crime Headlines" episode, and finally - as requested - an update on the Love Has Won cult and the death of Mother God. item.title: Episode 143: The Mysterious Death of Ellen Greenberg
item.description:
CW: This episode includes extensive discussion on suicide and domestic violence A vibrant young woman was found by her fiancé, stabbed to death inside their shared apartment. Police arrived, found she suffered twenty stab wounds to her front and back, and quickly determined her cause of death was… suicide? The Medical Examiner first disagreed and called it a homicide, but caved to pressure and changed his opinion to suicide. Now her parents have assembled a team of world-renowned forensic experts who all agree on one thing - their daughter was killed by someone else’s hand. Will a civil lawsuit help put them on a path to justice?

item.title: Episode 142: The Murder of Zona Heaster, the Greenbrier Ghost (ATWWD Crossover)
item.description:
This week we were thrilled to be joined by Christine and Em of And That's Why We Drink to discuss a true crime that also involves the paranormal - something for both of them, and for everyone else! Be sure to also check out our appearance on their show that will come out next Sunday, June 20th, wherever you listen to your podcasts! A young woman was unexpectedly found dead, and her mother suspected something more sinister - possibly her drifter husband - was to blame. When her daughter appeared to her as a ghastly figure, she confirmed the mother’s suspicions and all the details of the murder. Would the ghost’s story be enough to bring her killer to justice?

item.title: Episode 141: Bentinho Massaro, Instagram Guru
item.description: Like, follow, share, subscribe. Social media has become a way for us to connect with friends, keep up with the news, and more recently, get sucked into possibly harmful spiritual groups. One so-called Instagram guru has founded his community online - touting his ability to control the weather, his connection with aliens, and his status as an actual God. Is he inviting followers to an enlightened lifestyle, or recruiting suckers to fund his exotic vacations, fine whiskies, and expensive cigars? Learn more about your ad choices. item.title: Episode 138: The Disappearance of Kristin Smart - Part 3
item.description: Years passed and the Smart family was no closer to finding answers for what happened to their daughter on May 25, 1996. Once civilians and private detectives stepped in, the family saw some progress. It wasn't until a new sheriff was elected that moves were made. What eventually brought the case close to an end was a breakout podcast that shed new light on the details and unearthed new clues, finally leading to some arrests in the case. item.title: Episode 137: The Disappearance of Kristin Smart - Part 2
item.description: With their daughter missing, her devastated parents relied on law enforcement to conduct a thorough investigation. To their dismay, the case was passed between departments and delayed long enough for key evidence to be lost. Despite sufficient evidence for officers to identify a suspect, they needed his cooperation to close the case. All the suspect was willing to do was plead the fifth. Decades would pass before they got any real answers. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Episode 136: The Disappearance of Kristin Smart - Part 1
item.description: Four students leaving a party. A dark street. A short walk back to campus. But for one college freshman, the person trusted to walk her home seems to be the reason she was never seen again. For decades, the case lingered, the investigation changed hands, and it wasn’t until a renewed media scrutiny that arrests were made. Did authorities have their suspect from day 1? item.title: Episode 134: The Murder of Kitty Genovese - Part 1
item.description:
For 50 years, psychology textbooks used the tragic story of a murdered young woman to teach students about the devastating impact of inaction by neighbors. The magic number - 38 - was chosen by the media as the number of careless onlookers who heard the woman’s demise in real-time and did nothing. But the true story of what happened that night teaches us that even when there are bystanders, there are still plenty of helpers willing to come running when they’re called to aid a beloved friend.

item.title: Episode 129: Jayna Murray - The Lululemon Murder

item.title: Episode 127: The Buddhafield Cult
item.description: A charismatic leader with a Zen philosophy and a fitness model physique. A crowd of eager young disciples looking for a direct path to God. On the outside, this group had all the features of a Shangri-La society but on the inside, it became mandatory to worship the leader and submit to his every whim. item.title: Announcement: Winter Storms
item.description: Hey y'all ! We are trying our best to get online and bring you some creepy content, but historic storms in the Dallas area have made that impossible. We’ll be back as soon as we can. We hope everyone impacted by the storm is safe and warm. We miss you all and can’t wait to come back soon. Thanks for listening and keep it creepy. item.title: The #FreeBritney Movement: Part 2 (Re-release)
item.description: Hey everyone, we’re still out on maternity leave. This week we’re bringing you a double feature re-release of our coverage on the #FreeBritney movement. If you haven't already, check out part 1 of our coverage. You can also watch The New York Times new documentary, "Framing Britney Spears" which shows the unfair and invasive media coverage Britney received as she struggled under the scrutiny of the public eye. This episode covers the beginning of the conservatorship, its legal intricacies, how it has changed over the years, and sadly, how it's stayed much the same, even while Britney has become, what her lawyer has called, "highly functioning." After checking out these throwback episodes, you can head over to our Patreon for some bonus content like our minisodes, including our update on the FreeBritney movement that was released after these episodes. We also have other bonus content like mixed bags, Wheel segments and Am I the Asshole questions - where Reddit users ask whether they're acting like assholes and we judge them! Enjoy the episode! Thanks so much and keep it creepy _As one of the biggest pop stars in the world, the paparazzi’s cameras were trained on her as she struggled to maintain control of her life. Then she wound up in one of the most restrictive arrangements under the law. Her family and legal team said it was necessary, but fans believed their beloved icon was begging for their help on her social media pages. Then the movement finally found some traction - but what happens next? _ Support Sinisterhood Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.content:encoded:
Hey everyone, we’re still out on maternity leave. This week we’re bringing you a double feature re-release of our coverage on the #FreeBritney movement. 

If you haven't already, check out part 1 of our coverage. You can also watch The New York Times new documentary, "Framing Britney Spears" which shows the unfair and invasive media coverage Britney received as she struggled under the scrutiny of the public eye.

This episode covers the beginning of the conservatorship, its legal intricacies, how it has changed over the years, and sadly, how it's stayed much the same, even while Britney has become, what her lawyer has called, "highly functioning."

After checking out these throwback episodes, you can head over to our Patreon for some bonus content like our minisodes, including our update on the FreeBritney movement that was released after these episodes. We also have other bonus content like mixed bags, Wheel segments and Am I the Asshole questions - where Reddit users ask whether they're acting like assholes and we judge them!

Enjoy the episode! Thanks so much and keep it creepy

_As one of the biggest pop stars in the world, the paparazzi’s cameras were trained on her as she struggled to maintain control of her life. Then she wound up in one of the most restrictive arrangements under the law. Her family and legal team said it was necessary, but fans believed their beloved icon was begging for their help on her social media pages. Then the movement finally found some traction - but what happens next? _

Support Sinisterhood

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: The #FreeBritney Movement: Part 1 (Re-release)
item.description: Hey everyone, we’re still out on maternity leave. This week we’re bringing you a double feature re-release of our coverage on the #FreeBritney movement. Britney is still under the conservatorship and the control of her dad. The New York Times released the documentary "Framing Britney Spears" which featured video footage spanning the many years of this restrictive arrangement. This episode covers Britney's early years all the way through the actions that caused her dad to petition for a conservatorship. After checking out these throwback episodes, you can head over to our Patreon for some bonus content like our minisodes, including our update on the FreeBritney movement that was released after these episodes. We also have other bonus content like mixed bags, Wheel segments and Am I the Asshole questions - where Reddit users ask whether they're acting like assholes and we judge them! Enjoy the episode! Thanks so much and keep it creepy _Starting with her pigtailed debut, she rocketed to stardom as one of the biggest pop stars of all time. At first, all her dreams seemed to be coming true. But behind the scenes, things weren’t going so well for this icon. A divorce. A custody battle. Stints in the hospital for mental health reasons then finally, her rights were stripped away via an allegedly temporary legal mechanism. A decade later, the conservatorship remains. How could a pop legend end up with her every move controlled? _ Support Sinisterhood Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: The Dyatlov Pass Incident (Re-release)
item.description: Hey everyone, we’re still out on maternity leave. (You like how I said “we”??) This week we’re bringing you a classic episode that’s been making the headlines recently. National Geographic has reported that scientists using animation software from the movie Frozen have determined what really happens to the hikers of the Dyatlov pass incident. Did they finally prove that the KGB stalked the hikers and took them out? Or did they find evidence of a yeti? Aliens? Olaf? Not quite. They’re saying it was a simple explanation - the hikers perished in an avalanche. But listen on, because there is a mountain of evidence that points to a much more sinister explanation. After checking out this throwback episode, you can head over to our Patreon for some bonus content like our minisodes, mixed bags, Wheel segments and Am I the Asshole questions - where Reddit users ask whether they're acting like assholes and we judge them! Enjoy the episode! Thanks so much and keep it creepy Nine hikers go missing on a treacherous and difficult hike up, what some call, Dead Mountain. Russian Military, aliens, bigfoot - who or what is to blame for the Dyatlov Pass incident? Support Sinisterhood Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.itunes:subtitle: Nine hikers go missing on a treacherous and difficult hike up, what some call, Dead Mountain. Russian Military, aliens, Bigfoot - who or what is to blame for the Dyatlov Pass incident?

item.title: God's Salvation Church (Re-release)
item.description: Hey everyone, we’re taking this week off. We're re-releasing one of our favorite past episodes - Gods Salvation Church about a Dallas-based doomsday cult and it's rise and fall in one of our local suburbs. After checking out this throwback episode, you can head over to our Patreon for some bonus content like our minisodes, mixed bags, and Wheel segments where we spin an actual game show wheel to determine what we're going to talk about! Thanks so much and keep it creepy! On the brink of the new millennium, one man claims to know the day God will return to Earth...and He's doing it on a spaceship. When he and the rest of the UFOlogy cult take up residence in a Texas suburb, decked out in all white and cowboy hats, officials fear they may have a Heaven's Gate situation on their hands. Will it end as badly as everyone thinks, or will Hon-Ming Chen turn out to be just another false prophet? Support Sinisterhood Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: The Disappearance of Ben McDaniel (Re-release)
item.description: Hey everyone, we’re taking this week off. Since it's January 13, we're re-releasing one of our absolute favorite episodes - the infamous episode 13. This episode covers the unexplained disappearance of cave diver Ben McDaniel and his family's search for answers. But, is that all it covers? It also includes one of the most infamous Sinisterhood stories of all time. After taking a walk down memory lane, you can head over to our Patreon for some bonus content like our minisodes, mixed bags, and Wheel segments where we spin an actual game show wheel to determine what we're going to talk about! We have lots of fun, new weekly content while we're on break so check it out! Thanks so much and keep it creepy. _Sunny Florida. Sand. Surf. Scuba Diving. It sounds like a paradise, but down below the clear waters of Vortex Spring lies a cave so deadly it's kept under lock and key. A diver goes missing. Is he just another tragic case of accidental death or is something more sinister to blame. _ Support Sinisterhood Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Introducing 'Power: The Maxwells'
item.description:
Everyone’s heard of Ghislaine Maxwell, Jeffery Epstein’s alleged partner in crime. But there’s a shadowy figure who hangs above her who you likely don’t know: her father, media tycoon Robert Maxwell.
His rise from nothing, to his success as a businessman, to his fall from the deck of his super yacht under mysterious circumstances, is something straight out of a crime novel. And his favorite daughter Ghislaine’s theory?: her father was murdered.
From Somethin’ Else, makers of ‘The Immaculate Deception’ and ‘Faultline: Bush, Blair & Iraq’, hosted by Investigative journalist Tara Palmeri, ‘Power: The Maxwells’ is a seven part series on the incredible true story of a media mogul whose legacy is still being felt today and the family saga of Ghislaine, a millionaire daddy’s girl who became an accused sex trafficker and her brother, Kevin, who became Britain’s biggest personal bankrupt.
'Power: The Maxwells’ tells the story of a family like no other - a rags to riches to rags again tale of power and greed. New episodes drop every Tuesday wherever you get your podcasts. We know we'll be listening and we hope you will, too. Support Sinisterhood
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

If you do, subscribe to our Patreon for weekly editions, including one that was just released yesterday. item.title: Episode 123: The Disappearance of Brian Shaffer

item.title: Episode 122: Bigfoot
item.description: Footprints in the woods. Shaky film footage. Hundreds of reported encounters. This cryptid has roamed the forests of the Pacific Northwest for decades. Even with new evidence, scientific explanations, and reports from the FBI to the contrary, those who believe in his existence are absolutely convinced he is real. Does this beast truly walk among us, or is it just a tall and hairy tale? Support Sinisterhood Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: D.B. Cooper (Re-release)
item.description: Hey everyone, we’re taking the week off. We’ll be back next week with a brand new episode. This week, we're re-releasing our episode on the only unsolved American sky jacking case in history, D. B. Cooper. In the meantime, you can head over to our Patreon for some bonus content like our minisodes, including a recent update on the #FreeBritney movement. We also added an all new segment, THE WHEEL, where we spin an actual game show wheel and discuss topics chosen by you. Thanks so much and keep it creepy! The late 1960s were a golden age of air travel - spacious legroom, glamorous flight attendants, delicious meals on every flight... and a rash of violent hijackings. Some were politically motivated, while others were fueled by greed. The most famous and mysterious hijacker of all took control of a 727 with nothing more than a black briefcase, a handwritten note, and a pair of sunglasses. He got his money, and his parachutes, then disappeared into the night, never to be heard from again. Did he die in the Washington wilderness? Or did he manage to make an escape with his bag of cash? Support Sinisterhood Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

In the meantime, you can head over to our Patreon for some bonus content like our minisodes, including a recent update on the #FreeBritney movement.

We also added an all new segment, THE WHEEL, where we spin an actual game show wheel and discuss topics chosen by you.

Thanks so much and keep it creepy!

The late 1960s were a golden age of air travel - spacious legroom, glamorous flight attendants, delicious meals on every flight... and a rash of violent hijackings. Some were politically motivated, while others were fueled by greed. The most famous and mysterious hijacker of all took control of a 727 with nothing more than a black briefcase, a handwritten note, and a pair of sunglasses. He got his money, and his parachutes, then disappeared into the night, never to be heard from again. Did he die in the Washington wilderness? Or did he manage to make an escape with his bag of cash?

item.title: Episode 121: The Thanksgiving Day Murders
item.description: Thanksgiving is a holiday for people to gather with family and friends. But for two men, it was the last day of their lives. After catching the perpetrators red handed, police were sure they had a guaranteed conviction. But loophole after loophole ensured the killers were acquitted. Finally, a federal judge found a loophole of his own and managed to put the criminals behind bars for something other than murder. Support Sinisterhood Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: QAnon (Re-release)
item.description: Hey everyone, we’re taking the week off. We’ll be back next week with a brand new episode. Please enjoy this all-too-timely re-release, our episode on QAnon. You can also head over to our Patreon for some bonus content like our all-new Wheel segment, and our latest minisode on Zozo the Ouija Board demon. Thanks so much and keep it creepy. The internet is home to a wide range of tales, fringe groups, and conspiracy theories. But one theory has become the centralized narrative to unite them all. It starts in Washington D.C. and extends from Hollywood, around the globe, and even into space. Has a message board managed to get a straight line to the white house or is this just another case of the internet gone wild? Support Sinisterhood Learn more about your ad choices. item.title: Episode 113: The #FreeBritney Movement: Part 1
item.description: Starting with her pigtailed debut, she rocketed to stardom as one of the biggest pop stars of all time. At first, all her dreams seemed to be coming true. But behind the scenes, things weren’t going so well for this icon. A divorce. A custody battle. Stints in the hospital for mental health reasons then finally, her rights were stripped away via an allegedly temporary legal mechanism. A decade later, the conservatorship remains. How could a pop legend end up with her every move controlled? Support Sinisterhood Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Episode 112: The Trans-Allegheny Lunatic Asylum
item.description: The gorgeous architecture and intricate stonework hide a century’s worth of abuse and horrors in this now-abandoned facility. At the height of its operation, the rooms and halls were filled with vulnerable and abused patients. Now closed, this asylum is supposedly occupied by otherworldly residents and has gained a reputation as one of the most haunted places in America. item.title: Introducing Smoke Screen: Fake Priest
item.description:
Father Ryan was a popular priest who spent the last thirty years traveling the Midwest swindling millions of dollars out of people where he used the money to enrich himself, spend away, and declare bankruptcy whenever outed for falsifying his identity. Despite this, only once did law enforcement officially charge Father Ryan with crimes related to his church. But even then, he managed to essentially win the case. He’s now free and working on his next con.
Smoke Screen: Fake Priest from Neon Hum Media, is a new documentary podcast hosted by Alex Schuman, a news reporter from the Midwest, that has been chasing Father Ryan’s story for years. The craziest part is that Alex also gets an exclusive sit-down interview with Ryan himself and in it, the Fake Priest reveals a shocking secret.
Make sure to subscribe and follow Fake Priest now to find out what the shocking secret is. To listen to the show, just search for Smoke Screen: Fake Priest in Apple Podcasts or wherever you listen to your podcasts. Support Sinisterhood
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Feed Drop: The Why You...? Podcast
item.description:
Hey guys. Christie and Heather here. As you may have noticed from the title of this week's episode, we're doing something different. After talking about it, we decided that given the renewed focus on racial justice, criminal justice reform, and the violent actions of the government against protestors and the black community, we wanted to step back from the mic and instead amplify the voices of black creators and create space to share their show with you.
The Why You...? Podcast is a brand new podcast by fellow Texans, and husband and wife duo, Mikayla and Alfonso Davis. Their first three episodes dropped June 2 and can be found on Apple Podcasts, Google Play, and Spotify. We're bringing you their first episode which focuses on anxiety and how they have coped with it throughout their lives. They are funny, charming, and inviting. We are so grateful that they're letting us share their first episode with you and know you'll love it just as much as we do.
Like, subscribe, share, and follow them on social media on Instagram at WhyYouPod_ and on twitter at WhyYouPod. Also head to their feed where you'll find two more episodes. Links are in the show notes.
If you're like us, you have spent a lot of time this week wondering how you can show your support to the black community and protesters. We have compiled a list of resources we hope you find helpful. Head to our website and click “Justice Resources” in the top right corner to find ways to help. Please enjoy this episode. Thank you so much and stay safe! Support Sinisterhood
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

Hey guys. Christie and Heather here. As you may have noticed from the title of this week's episode, we're doing something different. After talking about it, we decided that given the renewed focus on racial justice, criminal justice reform, and the violent actions of the government against protestors and the black community, we wanted to step back from the mic and instead amplify the voices of black creators and create space to share their show with you.

The Why You...? Podcast is a brand new podcast by fellow Texans, and husband and wife duo, Mikayla and Alfonso Davis. Their first three episodes dropped June 2 and can be found on Apple Podcasts, Google Play, and Spotify. We're bringing you their first episode which focuses on anxiety and how they have coped with it throughout their lives. They are funny, charming, and inviting. We are so grateful that they're letting us share their first episode with you and know you'll love it just as much as we do.

Like, subscribe, share, and follow them on social media on Instagram at WhyYouPod_ and on twitter at WhyYouPod. Also head to their feed where you'll find two more episodes. Links are in the show notes.

If you're like us, you have spent a lot of time this week wondering how you can show your support to the black community and protesters. We have compiled a list of resources we hope you find helpful. Head to our website and click “Justice Resources” in the top right corner to find ways to help. Please enjoy this episode. Thank you so much and stay safe!

item.title: Episode 100: Bohemian Grove
item.description: Once a year, America’s wealthiest and most influential men descend on a collection of cabins in the lush forests of Northern California. They claim the retreat is a break from business, meant to recharge and relax their minds. But some people believe the true plans are something more sinister. Are these titans of politics and industry meeting to perform satanic rituals in an attempt to take over the world? Or is that even necessary since they already run it? Support Sinisterhood Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Episode 99: The Jenny Jones Show Murder: Part 2
item.description: A man’s life was taken at the hands of an enraged murderer. But once the first verdict was thrown out on a technicality, the killer got another shot to present his case to a jury. The victim’s family then decided to take on the production company and very show that they believed had a hand in their son’s death. The outcome would have an impact on television and the legal system that would last for decades. fffpartner Support Sinisterhood Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Episode 97: Unidentified Aerial Phenomena
item.description: For centuries, humankind has seen objects in the sky. For every report they’ve made, those who have claimed to see unidentified flying objects have been mocked and brushed off by skeptics. But with the advent of modern technology, those sightings have now been recorded, and some have been released to the public. Were the US’s most elite pilots witness to a visitor from another planet? Or was this merely an encounter with a highly advanced Earth-based foe? Support Sinisterhood Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

Is this a simple bit of folklore, or should we heed the warnings of her cry as a centuries-old harbinger of death?

item.description: 20 years ago on New Year's Eve, the world held its breath as the clock ticked down towards midnight. Planes falling from the sky. Bank accounts drain to zero. After witnesses come forward and fresh eyes weigh in on the case, a Texas court issues an eleventh-hour reprieve, preventing the wrong man from being executed for a crime he did not commit. It starts in Washington D.C. and extends from Hollywood, around the globe, and even into space. Has a message board managed to get a straight line to the white house or is this just another case of the internet gone wild?

Go to fabfitfun.com and enter CREEPY for $10 off your first box!

item.title: Episode 73: Extreme Haunted Houses
item.description: Haunted houses, roller coasters, scary movies - these are all fun ways to get your adrenaline pumping and a nice healthy dose of fear. But for some, this just doesn't cut it. These thrill-seeking adrenaline junkies seek to experience a type of terror that can only be achieved by being beaten, buried alive, waterboarded, and psychologically tormented. Fortunately for them, many extreme haunted houses will happily make all their nightmares come true. Support Sinisterhood Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Episode 69: D. B. Cooper
item.description: The late 1960s were a golden age of air travel - spacious legroom, glamorous flight attendants, delicious meals on every flight... and a rash of violent hijackings. Some were politically motivated, while others were fueled by greed. The most famous and mysterious hijacker of all took control of a 727 with nothing more than a black briefcase, a handwritten note, and a pair of sunglasses. He got his money, and his parachutes, then disappeared into the night, never to be heard from again. Did he die in the Washington wilderness? Or did he manage to make an escape with his bag of cash? This demonic presence has stalked the lush green southern coast of the Garden State for centuries. item.title: Episode 67: Forrest Fenn's Hidden Treasure
item.description: There are many ways to get rich - be born into money, win the lottery, work hard, or solve a series of clues written into a poem by an eccentric, modern-day Indiana Jones. Thousands of people have undertaken the search, but still, the treasure remains hidden. Are the clues as easy to solve as the writer would have you believe? With at least two people coming within 200 feet of the orante Romanesque chest filled with ancient artifacts, jewels, and gold, there is hope that a thrill-seeking treasure hunter will find the treasure of a lifetime. item.title: Episode 64: Terry Rasmussen: The Chameleon Killer
item.description: A man with no identity, he gave different names and stories to everyone he met. Popping in and out of cities, never leaving a trace. Until one day, he left the biggest clue of all - an abandoned little girl, left at a trailer park. Years later police would learn his crimes spanned the country and decades, and a team of strangers made up of law enforcement and everyday people would finally get some closure on one of the biggest cold cases of their careers. item.title: Episode 56: NXIVM: Revisited
item.description: Self-Help. Personal Growth. Life-improvement. Multi-level marketing schemes promise riches, better lives, and unimagined happiness. But beneath the surface of this organization was a secret society that drained its members of money, personal autonomy, and even their lives. Self-Help. Personal Growth. Life-improvement. Multi-level marketing schemes promise riches, better lives, and unimagined happiness. But beneath the surface of this organization was a secret society that drained its members of money, personal autonomy, and even their lives. A sex cult where women were referred to as "slaves", branded like cattle, and forced to have sex with a leader they called Vanguard all under the guise of "female empowerment."

item.title: Episode 50: Ted Bundy: Part 1
item.description: One of America’s most prolific and renowned serial killers, Ted Bundy was known for his charming smile, magnetic personality, and violent and sadistic tendencies. For decades his rage simmered beneath the surface, until one day he was exposed for the monster he always had been. In the first of our three-part series, we discuss Bundy's childhood, teenage and college years, and the incident that psychiatrist's call the pivotal moment in his development as a psychopath.
